result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Davila was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: *Defendant to advise any and all employers of this case and the specifics of this case.
*No contact with the victims, S.D. and E. D.-R.;

*Cooperate and participate in SEX OFFENDER EVALUATION and any recommended treatment; 
*Sexual Offender Registry for FIVE (5) years.

supervisions.notes:
*Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge; 
*Pay all remaining mandatory costs, fees, surcharges and assessments by the end of probation period or balance to convert to civil judgment;
*HUBER FOR WORK, with credit for FOUR (4) DAYS time served FORTHWITH. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: *Count 1 conditions apply except for condition time.

Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.  

(Return address: Joshua Davila #765205407, House of Correction, 8885 South 68th Street, Franklin, WI  53132-8202).
Request to Issue Civil Judgment for Unpaid Court Obligations. ew

ADA Karshen called the Court and informed the Clerk that the Defendant has been arrested on new charges and requested that the 4/10/17 review hearing date be removed.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Joshua Davila in court pro se.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Jennifer Kostrzewa appeared for the Department of Corrections.

Matter here for a review hearing.  The Defendant just recently started sex offender treatment and he has been cooperative with that treatment.  The State request we have an additional review hearing to see how Defendant is doing in treatment.  Matter set for a review hearing on April 10, 2017 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Probation Status Review, received and filed.

Defendant Joshua Davila in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Sentencing.  Due to the Court being in trial and unavailable, parties requested an adjournment.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter set for sentencing on September 16, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Joshua Davila in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  AS TO COUNTS #1, #2 AND #3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT #4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
  
Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

The Court VACATED the August 31, 2016 Jury Trial date and that is now going to be a sentencing date.  Matter set for sentencing to August 31, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court
Deputy Court Clerk tg

FILED, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Matter here for a plea hearing.  The Court adjourned the matter due to the Court currently being in trial and unavailable.  Matter is adjourned to August 19, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for a plea hearing.

Defendant Joshua Davila in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Final Pre-trial and a Motion Hearing.  Due to the Court being down, this matter was adjourned.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter adjourned for a plea hearing to August 16, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.   Parties advised effective July 30, 2016, this case will be reassigned to Judge Conen, Branch 30, Room 502 of the Safety Building.
